main module

class main.FVThread(func, *args)[source]

Bases: QObject

A class to run a function in a separate thread with progress and finished signals.

finished

pyqtSignal(*types, name: str = …, revision: int = …, arguments: Sequence = …) -> PYQT_SIGNAL

types is normally a sequence of individual types. Each type is either a type object or a string that is the name of a C++ type. Alternatively each type could itself be a sequence of types each describing a different overloaded signal. name is the optional C++ name of the signal. If it is not specified then the name of the class attribute that is bound to the signal is used. revision is the optional revision of the signal that is exported to QML. If it is not specified then 0 is used. arguments is the optional sequence of the names of the signal’s arguments.

progress

pyqtSignal(*types, name: str = …, revision: int = …, arguments: Sequence = …) -> PYQT_SIGNAL

types is normally a sequence of individual types. Each type is either a type object or a string that is the name of a C++ type. Alternatively each type could itself be a sequence of types each describing a different overloaded signal. name is the optional C++ name of the signal. If it is not specified then the name of the class attribute that is bound to the signal is used. revision is the optional revision of the signal that is exported to QML. If it is not specified then 0 is used. arguments is the optional sequence of the names of the signal’s arguments.

run()[source]

Execute the function in the thread, emitting progress and finished signals.

class main.FractalCanvas(width=30, height=20, dpi=100)[source]

Bases: FigureCanvasQTAgg

A class for creating a canvas to display various fractals.

clear_plot()[source]

Clear the current plot.

plot_bifurcation_from_point(real, imag, step=1e-05, precision=100)[source]

Plot the bifurcation diagram starting from a given point in the complex plane.

Parameters:

  • real – Real part of the complex number.

  • imag – Imaginary part of the complex number.

  • step – Step size for the calculation, defaults to 0.00001.

  • precision – Precision for the calculation, defaults to 100.

plot_logistical(step=1e-05, precision=100)[source]

Plot the logistic map.

Parameters:

  • step – Step size for the calculation, defaults to 0.00001.

  • precision – Precision for the calculation, defaults to 100.

plot_mandelbrot_bw(step=1e-05, precision=100)[source]

Plot the Mandelbrot set in black and white.

Parameters:

  • step – Step size for the calculation, defaults to 0.00001.

  • precision – Precision for the calculation, defaults to 100.

plot_mandelbrot_col(step=0.05, precision=20)[source]

Plot the Mandelbrot set in color.

Parameters:

  • step – Step size for the calculation, defaults to 0.05.

  • precision – Precision for the calculation, defaults to 20.

class main.KeyListener(mandelbrot_canvas, logistic_canvas)[source]

Bases: QObject

A class to handle mouse click events on the Mandelbrot canvas and update the logistic canvas accordingly.

on_click(event)[source]

Handle mouse click events on the Mandelbrot canvas and plot the bifurcation diagram on the logistic canvas.

Parameters:

event – The mouse click event.

class main.MainFrame[source]

Bases: QMainWindow

Main window for the Fractal Visualizer application.

check_text_is_number_float(line_edit)[source]

Check if the text in the given QLineEdit is a valid floating point number.

Parameters:

line_edit – QLineEdit to check.

Returns:

True if the text is a valid float, False otherwise.

check_text_is_number_int(line_edit)[source]

Check if the text in the given QLineEdit is a valid integer.

Parameters:

line_edit – QLineEdit to check.

Returns:

True if the text is a valid integer, False otherwise.

Initialize the controls frame with options for adjusting and regenerating plots.

Initialize the menu bar and add menu items for the application.

Initialize the plot frame containing the Mandelbrot and logistic canvases.

init_ui()[source]

Initialize the main UI layout of the application.

Load and apply a Qt stylesheet to the application.

Parameters:

stylesheet – Path to the stylesheet file.

on_thread_finished(message)[source]

Handle the finished signal from the thread.

Parameters:

message – The message emitted by the finished signal.

on_thread_progress(message)[source]

Handle the progress signal from the thread.

Parameters:

message – The message emitted by the progress signal.

regenerate_logistical_plot()[source]

Regenerate the logistic plot based on user-specified precision and step values.

regenerate_mandel_plot()[source]

Regenerate the Mandelbrot plot based on user-specified precision and step values.

run_thread(func, *args)[source]

Run a given function in a separate thread with specified arguments.

Parameters:

  • func – The function to run in the thread.

  • args – Arguments to pass to the function.

save_all()[source]

Save the current plots as image files in a user-selected directory.
